DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Deviations Domain Eligibility Determination Source
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The source used to determine the eligibility status of a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Deviations Domain Eligibility Determination Source
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to protocol deviations._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.: A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Concepts.definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The description of cells and tissues made by a pathologist based on microscopic evidence, and sometimes used to make a diagnosis of a disease.

Concepts.definition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.: A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
